module.name: fpHttp
module.short: HTTP request handling for web servers

descr.p: The fphttp unit provides the foundation for handling HTTP requests in web server applications. It implements content producers, web actions, and web modules for processing HTTP requests and generating responses.
The idea behind the web module and action architecture is that they process an URL of the following kind:
Where the appropriate module is determined by the http router and the correct action is selected by the module. The action's event handler will then be executed.

If your application requires a more flexible URL handling, you may want to register callbacks directly with the HTTP router. If you are looking to generate HTML, then the unit contains web modules that descend from but are geared towards generating HTML.

element.name: TWebModuleKind
element.descr: TWebModuleKind defines how web modules are created and managed during request handling.

element.name: TWebModuleKind.wkPooled
element.short: Module instances are pooled and reused

element.name: TWebModuleKind.wkOneShot
element.short: New module instance created for each request

element.name: TWebActionEvent
element.short: Event handler for web action processing
element.descr: TWebActionEvent is an event type for handling web action processing before or after request handling.

element.name: TWebActionEvent.Handled
element.short: Indicates if the request has been handled

element.name: THTTPContentProducer
element.short: Base class for HTTP content production
element.descr: THTTPContentProducer is the base class for generating HTTP content. It provides methods for handling requests and producing content for HTTP responses.

element.name: THTTPContentProducer.HandleRequest
element.descr: HandleRequest processes an HTTP request and sets the handled flag if the request was processed.

element.name: THTTPContentProducer.HandleRequest.Handled
element.short: Set to True if request was handled

element.name: THTTPContentProducer.GetContent
element.short: Retrieves content for the HTTP response
element.descr: GetContent retrieves the content to be sent as the HTTP response body.

element.name: THTTPContentProducer.GetContent.Handled
element.short: Set to True if content was generated

element.name: THTTPContentProducer.HaveContent
element.descr: HaveContent returns True if the content producer can generate content for the current request.

element.name: THTTPContentProducer.ContentToStream
element.descr: ContentToStream writes the generated content directly to a stream and returns the number of bytes written.

element.name: THTTPContentProducer.ContentToStream.Result
element.short: Number of bytes written to stream

element.name: THTTPContentProducer.Request
element.descr: Request provides access to the current HTTP request being processed.

element.name: THTTPContentProducer.Response
element.descr: Response provides access to the current HTTP response being generated.

descr.p: TCustomWebAction represents an individual web action that can handle specific HTTP requests. It associates a content producer or a simple event with request handling events. Web actions are selected by the module by checking the second path element in the HTTP URL:

element.name: TCustomWebAction.GetNamePath
element.descr: GetNamePath returns the full path name of the action for identification purposes.

element.name: TCustomWebAction.GetNamePath.Result
element.short: Full name path of the action

element.name: TCustomWebAction.Name
element.descr: Name specifies the unique name used to identify this web action.

element.name: TCustomWebAction.ContentProducer
element.descr: ContentProducer specifies the content producer responsible for generating the response content.

element.name: TCustomWebAction.Default
element.short: Indicates if this is the default action
element.descr: Default specifies whether this action should be used as the default when no specific action is requested.

element.name: TCustomWebAction.BeforeRequest
element.descr: BeforeRequest is triggered before the request is processed by the action.

element.name: TCustomWebAction.AfterResponse
element.descr: AfterResponse is triggered after the response has been generated by the action.

element.name: TGetActionEvent
element.descr: TGetActionEvent is triggered to determine which action should handle a specific request.

element.name: TGetActionEvent.ActionName
element.short: Name of the action to execute

element.name: TCustomWebActions
element.descr: TCustomWebActions manages a collection of web actions that can handle HTTP requests.

element.name: TCustomWebActions.Create
element.short: Creates a new web actions collection
element.descr: Create initializes a new web actions collection with the specified action item class.

element.name: TCustomWebActions.Assign
element.descr: Assign copies all actions from the source collection to this collection.

element.name: TCustomWebActions.Add
element.descr: Add creates and adds a new web action to the collection.

element.name: TCustomWebActions.ActionByName
element.descr: ActionByName returns the web action with the specified name, or raises an exception if not found.

element.name: TCustomWebActions.ActionByName.Result
element.short: The web action with the specified name

element.name: TCustomWebActions.ActionByName.AName
element.short: Name of the action to find

element.name: TCustomWebActions.FindAction
element.descr: FindAction searches for a web action with the specified name and returns nil if not found.

element.name: TCustomWebActions.FindAction.Result
element.short: The web action or nil if not found

element.name: TCustomWebActions.FindAction.AName
element.short: Name of the action to search for

element.name: TCustomWebActions.IndexOfAction
element.descr: IndexOfAction returns the index of the web action with the specified name, or -1 if not found.

element.name: TCustomWebActions.IndexOfAction.Result
element.short: Index of the action or -1 if not found

element.name: TCustomWebActions.IndexOfAction.AName
element.short: Name of the action to locate

element.name: TCustomWebActions.OnGetAction
element.descr: OnGetAction is triggered to determine which action should handle a request.

element.name: TCustomWebActions.Actions
element.descr: Actions provides indexed access to individual web actions in the collection.

element.name: TCustomWebActions.Actions.Index
element.short: Index of the action to access

element.name: TCustomWebActions.DefActionWhenUnknown
element.short: Use default action for unknown requests
element.descr: DefActionWhenUnknown determines whether the default action should handle requests for unknown actions.

element.name: TInitModuleEvent
element.descr: TInitModuleEvent is triggered when an HTTP module is initialized for request processing.

element.name: TCustomHTTPModule
element.descr: TCustomHTTPModule is the base class for HTTP modules that handle web requests. It provides the foundation for web applications with action-based request routing.

element.name: TCustomHTTPModule.CreateNew
element.short: Creates a new HTTP module instance
element.descr: CreateNew creates a new HTTP module instance with the specified owner and creation mode.

element.name: TCustomHTTPModule.Destroy
element.descr: Destroy frees the HTTP module instance and its associated resources.

element.name: TCustomHTTPModule.RegisterModule
element.short: Registers the module with the factory
element.descr: RegisterModule registers this HTTP module class with the module factory using the specified name.

element.name: TCustomHTTPModule.RegisterModule.AModuleName
element.short: Name to register the module under

element.name: TCustomHTTPModule.HandleRequest
element.descr: HandleRequest processes an HTTP request and generates the appropriate response.

element.name: TCustomHTTPModule.DoAfterInitModule
element.descr: DoAfterInitModule is called after the module has been initialized for the current request.

element.name: TCustomHTTPModule.Kind
element.descr: Kind determines how module instances are created and managed.

element.name: TCustomHTTPModule.BaseURL
element.descr: BaseURL specifies the base URL path that this module handles.

element.name: TCustomHTTPModule.AfterInitModule
element.descr: AfterInitModule is triggered after the module is initialized for request processing.

element.name: TCustomHTTPModuleClass
element.descr: TCustomHTTPModuleClass is a class reference type for HTTP module classes.

element.name: TSessionHTTPModule
element.descr: TSessionHTTPModule extends HTTP modules with session management capabilities. It automatically manages user sessions across multiple HTTP requests.

element.name: TSessionHTTPModule.destroy
element.descr: destroy frees the session HTTP module and its associated session resources.

element.name: TSessionHTTPModule.HandleRequest
element.descr: HandleRequest processes an HTTP request with automatic session management.

element.name: TSessionHTTPModule.CreateSession
element.short: Indicates if sessions should be created
element.descr: CreateSession determines whether new sessions are automatically created for requests.

element.name: TSessionHTTPModule.Session
element.descr: Session provides access to the current user session associated with the request.

element.name: TSessionHTTPModule.OnNewSession
element.short: Event triggered when a new session is created
element.descr: OnNewSession is triggered when a new user session is created.

element.name: TSessionHTTPModule.OnSessionExpired
element.short: Event triggered when a session expires
element.descr: OnSessionExpired is triggered when a user session expires due to timeout.

element.name: TSessionHTTPModuleClass
element.short: Class reference for session HTTP modules
element.descr: TSessionHTTPModuleClass is a class reference type for session-enabled HTTP module classes.

element.name: EWebSessionError
element.descr: EWebSessionError is raised when errors occur during session management operations.

element.name: TSessionFactory
element.descr: TSessionFactory provides session management functionality including creation, cleanup, and configuration.

element.name: TSessionFactory.CreateSession
element.descr: CreateSession creates a new user session for the specified HTTP request.

element.name: TSessionFactory.CreateSession.ARequest
element.short: HTTP request associated with the session

element.name: TSessionFactory.DoneSession
element.descr: DoneSession performs cleanup and finalization for the specified session.

element.name: TSessionFactory.CleanupSessions
element.descr: CleanupSessions removes expired sessions from the session storage.

element.name: TSessionFactory.CleanupInterval
element.descr: CleanupInterval specifies how often expired sessions are cleaned up, in minutes.

element.name: TSessionFactory.DefaultTimeOutMinutes
element.descr: DefaultTimeOutMinutes specifies the default timeout period for new sessions, in minutes.

element.name: TSessionFactory.SessionCookie
element.descr: SessionCookie specifies the name of the HTTP cookie used to store session identifiers.

element.name: TSessionFactory.SessionCookiePath
element.descr: SessionCookiePath specifies the path attribute for the session cookie.

element.name: TSessionFactoryClass
element.descr: TSessionFactoryClass is a class reference type for session factory classes.

element.name: TModuleItem
element.descr: TModuleItem holds registration information for an HTTP module in the module factory.

element.name: TModuleItem.Destroy
element.descr: Destroy frees the module item and its associated resources.

element.name: TModuleItem.ModuleClass
element.descr: ModuleClass specifies the class for this registered HTTP module.

element.name: TModuleItem.ModuleName
element.descr: ModuleName specifies the registered name for this HTTP module.

element.name: TModuleItem.SkipStreaming
element.descr: SkipStreaming determines whether component streaming is skipped for this module.

element.name: TOnModuleRequest
element.descr: TOnModuleRequest is an event type for handling requests at the module level.

element.name: TModuleFactory
element.descr: TModuleFactory manages the registration and creation of HTTP modules.

element.name: TModuleFactory.RegisterHTTPModule
element.descr: RegisterHTTPModule registers an HTTP module class with the factory.

element.name: TModuleFactory.RegisterHTTPModule.ModuleName
element.short: Name to register the module under

element.name: TModuleFactory.FindModule
element.descr: FindModule searches for a registered module with the specified name.

element.name: TModuleFactory.FindModule.Result
element.short: Module item or nil if not found

element.name: TModuleFactory.FindModule.AModuleName
element.short: Name of the module to find

element.name: TModuleFactory.ModuleByName
element.descr: ModuleByName returns the module item with the specified name, or raises an exception if not found.

element.name: TModuleFactory.ModuleByName.Result
element.short: Module item with the specified name

element.name: TModuleFactory.ModuleByName.AModuleName
element.short: Name of the module to retrieve

element.name: TModuleFactory.IndexOfModule
element.descr: IndexOfModule returns the index of the module with the specified name, or -1 if not found.

element.name: TModuleFactory.IndexOfModule.Result
element.short: Index of the module or -1 if not found

element.name: TModuleFactory.IndexOfModule.AModuleName
element.short: Name of the module to locate

element.name: TModuleFactory.RemoveModule
element.short: Removes a module from the factory
element.descr: RemoveModule unregisters the module with the specified name from the factory.

element.name: TModuleFactory.RemoveModule.AModuleName
element.short: Name of the module to remove

element.name: TModuleFactory.MoveModuleBeforeDefault
element.descr: MoveModuleBeforeDefault repositions the specified module to execute before the default module.

element.name: TModuleFactory.MoveModuleBeforeDefault.Result
element.short: True if module was moved successfully

element.name: TModuleFactory.MoveModuleBeforeDefault.AModuleName
element.short: Name of the module to move

element.name: TModuleFactory.Modules
element.descr: Modules provides indexed access to registered module items.

element.name: TModuleFactory.Modules.Index
element.short: Index of the module to access

element.name: TModuleFactory.OnModuleRequest
element.descr: OnModuleRequest is triggered when a request is being handled by a module.

element.name: EFPHTTPError
element.descr: EFPHTTPError is raised when errors occur during HTTP request processing.

element.name: RegisterHTTPModule
element.short: Registers an HTTP module with the factory
element.descr: RegisterHTTPModule is a convenience function to register an HTTP module class with the global module factory.

element.name: RegisterHTTPModule.ModuleName
element.short: Name to register the module under

element.name: ModuleFactory
element.descr: ModuleFactory is the global instance of the module factory for managing HTTP modules.

element.name: SessionFactoryClass
element.descr: SessionFactoryClass holds the class reference used to create session factory instances.

element.name: SessionFactory
element.short: Returns the global session factory instance
element.descr: SessionFactory returns the global session factory instance used for session management.

element.name: SErrNosuchModule
element.descr: SErrNosuchModule is the error message displayed when a requested module cannot be found.

element.name: SErrNoSuchAction
element.descr: SErrNoSuchAction is the error message displayed when a requested action cannot be found.

element.name: SErrUnknownAction
element.descr: SErrUnknownAction is the error message displayed for unrecognized or invalid actions.

element.name: SErrNoDefaultAction
element.short: Error message for missing default action
element.descr: SErrNoDefaultAction is the error message displayed when no default action is available.

element.name: SErrInvActNoDefaultAction
element.short: Error message for invalid action without default
element.descr: SErrInvActNoDefaultAction is the error message displayed when an invalid action is requested and no default action is available.

element.name: SErrRequestNotHandled
element.descr: SErrRequestNotHandled is the error message displayed when a request cannot be handled by any action.

element.name: SErrNoSessionFactoryClass
element.short: Error message for missing session factory class
element.descr: SErrNoSessionFactoryClass is the error message displayed when no session factory class is registered.

element.name: SErrNoSessionOutsideRequest
element.short: Error message for session access outside request
element.descr: SErrNoSessionOutsideRequest is the error message displayed when attempting to access session data outside of a request context.
